item.title: Scotland Hears Last-Minute Appeals on Independence Vote
item.description: The referendum’s potential effect on the economy, on public services and on defense were the subjects of debate in advance of the vote on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHEN CASTLE
item.media:description: Supporters of the "yes" campaign gathered in Glasgow, Scotland, on Tuesday.

item.title: Letter From India: Mumbai Rail System Pits Cool vs. the Crowds
item.description: How might the government air-condition a train? First, shut the doors of the train.
item.dc:creator: By MANU JOSEPH

item.title: Bad Vaccine Kills Up to 50 Children in Northern Syria
item.description: Volunteer medical organizations said the vaccine afflicted dozens of children in insurgent-held areas of Idlib Province.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE and HWAIDA SAAD

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Alan Cumming on Scotland’s Vote for Independence
item.description: The referendum is not about hating the English. It is about democracy and self-determination.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN CUMMING

item.title: With ISIS in U.S. Cross Hairs, Syria Pounces on Other Foes
item.description: Some of the more moderate insurgent groups trying to topple President Bashar al-Assad say his forces have been stepping up attacks on them.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD and MOHAMMAD GHANNAM

item.title: Ebola Could Devastate West African Economies, World Bank Says
item.description: A fear of contagion and what the bank called “aversion behavior” is driving most of the economic losses in the three nations hit hardest by the outbreak.
item.dc:creator: By SHERI FINK

item.title: Lens Blog: Keeping True to an Iranian Vision, Minus Big Money
item.description: Newsha Tavakolian returned a 50,000-euro prize rather than see her work about contemporary Iran be controlled — distorted, she says — by the financier whose foundation selected her.
item.category: Blank Pages of an Iranian Photo Album
item.dc:creator: By DAVID GONZALEZ

item.title: Obama Insists U.S. Will Not Get Drawn Into Ground War in Iraq
item.description: Addressing troops at Central Command base in Florida, President Obama said the United States was committed to destroying the Islamic State, but not with combat troops.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR

item.title: Vladimir P. Evtushenkov Is Accused of Laundering Money
item.description: Vladimir P. Evtushenkov, the majority shareholder in the conglomerate Sistema, has been accused of money laundering, but some say his arrest was politically motivated.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW ROTH

item.title: Shiite Militias Pose Challenge for U.S. in Iraq
item.description: The de facto coalition of militias, the United States and the Iraqi government against the Islamic State shows little promise for stability.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: Fighters with Asaib Ahl al-Haq, a Shiite militia, and Kurdish pesh merga forces on patrol earlier this month in Tikrit, Iraq.

item.title: Uighur Scholar Charged With Separatism Goes on Trial in China
item.description: The charges against Ilham Tohti, widely considered a moderate voice who has promoted dialogue, could result in a death sentence.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG
item.media:description: Ilham Tohti, a scholar of China's Turkic Uighur ethnic minority, at his home in Beijing in February 2013.

item.title: Much at Stake as Xi Jinping, Chinese Leader, Visits India
item.description: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosts Mr. Xi in the first visit by a Chinese president in eight years, the reasons for mutual good will are compelling.
item.dc:creator: By ELLEN BARRY
item.media:description: Indian police officers standing guard on Tuesday in front of a board with images of Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India, President Xi Jinping of China and Anandiben Patel, the chief minister of Gujarat.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Beijing Authorities Approve Formal Arrest of Jackie Chan’s Son
item.description: A district procurator’s declaration allows the police to continue holding Jaycee Chan and investigating drug charges against him.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Jaycee Chan was detained last month after a raid on his home in Beijing.

item.title: U.S. Army Chief Says Ground Troops Will Be Needed Against ISIS
item.description: Gen. Ray Odierno, the Army chief of staff, said “rooting out” militants on the ground would be necessary, but he did not say it had to be done by Americans.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: Gen. Ray Odierno, now the Army chief of staff, at a memorial for veterans last year.

item.title: U.S. Army Chief Says Ground Troops Will Be Needed Against ISIS
item.description: Gen. Ray Odierno, the Army chief of staff, said “rooting out” militants on the ground would be necessary, but he did not say it had to be done by Americans.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: Gen. Ray Odierno, now the Army chief of staff, at a memorial for veterans in July.

item.title: In Brutal Year for News Media in Afghanistan, a 7th Journalist Is Killed
item.description: The stabbing of Palwasha Tokhi adds to a toll that was already the deadliest for the news media in the country since the fall of the Taliban.
item.dc:creator: By ROD NORDLAND

item.title: Syrian Children Die After Getting Vaccinations
item.description: At least 15 children died after receiving vaccinations in rebel-held parts of Syria, many exhibiting signs of “severe allergic shock,” said a doctor who administered the vaccinations.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Letter From Africa: The Reality of Ebola, a World Away
item.description: One disadvantaged corner of the world is beset by a calamity, and the rest of the world peers in, incapable of understanding the extent of the chaos on the ground.
item.dc:creator: By ADAM NOSSITER
item.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times
item.media:description: People suffering from Ebola-like symptoms waited to be seen at an Ebola treatment center in Monrovia, Liberia, last month.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Is Egypt Doomed to Autocracy?
item.description: Those who say Muslim Arab society is not ready for democracy should recall Europe's 20th-century dictatorships.
item.dc:creator: By ALAA AL ASWANY

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Britain’s Sclerotic Politics
item.description: The Conservatives promised reform but didn't deliver. Britain needs democratic reform from the ground up.
item.dc:creator: By DOUGLAS CARSWELL

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China Under Pressure to Increase Ebola Aid as Crisis Grows
item.description: After the American announcement of increased aid to fight Ebola, some commentators called for more support from China, which has extensive investments in Africa.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:credit: Carl De Souza/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: Doctors Without Borders health workers wearing protective clothing to shield against Ebola at a clinic in Kailahun, Sierra Leone.

item.title: Islamic State Issues Video Challenge to Obama
item.description: The Islamic State has released a Hollywood-style video to respond to President Obama’s declaration that he would “degrade and ultimately destroy” it.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

item.title: Separatism Trial of Uighur Scholar Set to Begin in China
item.description: Ilham Tohti, widely considered a moderate voice who has promoted dialogue, is to be tried Wednesday on charges of separatism, which could result in a death sentence.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG

item.title: New York Man Charged With Trying to Support ISIS
item.description: The most significant accusation in the seven-count indictment of Mufid A. Elfgeeh of Rochester asserts that he tried to provide material support and resources to the Islamic State.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
item.media:credit: Monroe County Sheriff's Office, via Associated Press

item.title: Obama Presses Leaders to Speed Ebola Response
item.description: President Obama, warning that the disease could take hundreds of thousands of lives, called on other nations to help the United States as it leads the fight.
item.dc:creator: By HELENE COOPER and SHERI FINK
item.media:description: “This epidemic is going to get worse before it gets better,” President Obama said Tuesday in Atlanta, where he met with doctors who had just returned from Ebola-ravaged West Africa.
